direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods handle subscription to different types of products (locked and flexible) with similar parameter structures and validation logic.
Both methods involve operations on locked products and share similar control flows, parameter handling, and exception management.
The subscribeLockedProduct method likely depends on the list of available locked products, which is fetched by the lockedProductList method.
Both methods involve managing subscription settings for locked products, though one is for immediate subscription and the other for setting auto-subscription preferences.
The subscribeLockedProduct method might benefit from test cases that include previewing the subscription details, which is handled by the lockedSubscriptionPreview method.
The subscribeLockedProduct method might need to check the personal left quota for locked products, which is managed by the lockedPersonalLeftQuota method.
Both methods involve operations related to subscription records for locked products, though one is for subscribing and the other for retrieving subscription history.
